intro: Veronica benthamii, commonly known as the bentham's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid environments. It has small, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Veronica benthamii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along stream banks.
